title: Intermediate English 308
headline: Learn vocabulary related to job hunting and master the future continuous tense in this free online English course.
description: This course introduces you to some basic vocabulary related to applying for a job and will help you identify essential skills you will need when applying for a position. Explore how to use 'will,' 'be going to,' and 'be able to' in various forms, be introduced to the future continuous tense, and then discover how to use the tense for negative statements and questions. Enroll in this course, and start learning today!
courseDescription:
This English course aims to introduce you to vocabulary related to job searching and defines essential skills you will need when applying for a job. Once you have become familiar with the vocabulary of this course, you will delve into the grammar rules that will enable you to use the words you have mastered in a practical way.

The grammar topics explore the use of 'will' or 'be going to' to make future predictions or plans, and it also examines the past form of 'be going to' to indicate when your plans have changed. We will then demonstrate how to use and form sentences with 'be able to' to show ability. Finally, we will introduce you to the future continuous tense and uncover how to use it in various forms.

This course will allow you to review and complete activities developed to enhance your English reading, listening, and speaking skills. In addition, you will find a downloadable writing task in this course's 'Resources' section that will guide you in improving your writing skills. Enroll today to take another step forward in becoming proficient in this universal language.
